document_title: Bone calcification: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Bone calcification can be proactively prevented early on with some useful solutions as follows:
Carry out regular health examinations to check the amount of Calcium in the bones and detect abnormalities related to bone calcification (if any).; Some medications or therapies can affect the body's ability to metabolize calcium, such as blood pressure regulators, cholesterol, hormone replacement therapy, etc. Therefore, patients should discuss carefully. consult a doctor before use to avoid unwanted problems.; Quit the habit of smoking to avoid the risk of calcification in bones, heart and arteries.; Build a healthy diet, ensuring to provide the necessary amount of Calcium every day for the body with the following foods: seeds (sesame, chia seeds...), cheese, yogurt, almonds, kinds of bean…; Maintain a regular exercise routine every day to keep bones strong, improve blood circulation, and help the body transport Calcium to where it is needed instead of accumulating it in soft tissues.

This is also one of the pioneer units in diagnosing and treating musculoskeletal diseases with modern techniques according to updated international protocols.
The hospital is also equipped with modern machinery and imaging equipment such as: Somatom Drive 768-slice CT scanner, new generation Magnetom Amira BioMatrix magnetic resonance machine, Artis Pheno robot, densitometer. bones, ultrasound machines...; Opmi Vario 700 Zeiss surgical microscope system, Meera-Maquet operating table... to be able to detect injuries early and effectively treat musculoskeletal diseases...
